meanings.definition: The abnormal flattening or elongation of plant stems.
meanings.sent1: The fasciation of the stem caused it to grow in a twisted manner.
meanings.sent2: The gardener noticed the fasciation of the plant's stem and knew something was wrong.
meanings.sent3: The fasciation of the stem made the plant look like a curly straw.
meanings.sent4: The fasciation of the stem was like nature's own abstract art piece.
meanings.sent5: The fasciation of the stem was so unusual that it stuck in the gardener's memory.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming fascinated or captivated by something.
meanings.sent1: Her fasciation with the stars led her to study astronomy.
meanings.sent2: His fasciation with magic tricks made him practice every day.
meanings.sent3: The child's fasciation with bubbles made bath time a joy.
meanings.sent4: Her fasciation with history was like a never-ending adventure.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's fasciation with learning inspired her students to explore new topics.
